formattedAddress: 122 Dyckman St, New York, NY 10040, USA
adrFormatAddress: 122 Dyckman St, New York, NY 10040, USA

originalText.text:
My sister and I went here last night for the new happy hour deal they have that we saw online (Instagram). No one was there and we had the place to ourselves practically. Carlos, was our server/manager for the night and he did. not. disappoint. From the moment he greeted us, the service was up there… top notch. Told us the deals, asked and answered any questions we had and definitely knew how to sell it. The female working there as well was super nice, I didn’t get her name though. But both were attentive and made sure we were taken care of... We had a great conversation with him after our meal which was the icing on the cake. Told him
we will definitely be back, even if it’s by ourselves again or with our friends. Thank you Carlos! Best night out we had in a while...

originalText.text: Worse hibachi I ever been to. We had a party of 10 on Saturday night at 630pm. Even though the place was EMPTY, we didn’t eat dinner until 3hrs AFTER WE SAT at our table, because there was ONLY ONE chef on a SATURDAY NIGHT. Now to be fair, Carlos (the pretty cool manager) did warn us it would be a bit of a wait. But why even sit us if we wouldn’t be served for a whole 3hrs. Still, the worst part of my experience was the chefs lack of skill. A Mexican hibachi chef whose skill was constantly banging on the table for “dramatic effect” and accidentally dropping utensils. I was very unimpressed and could not help but to think “is this guy really a chef?” They sat all 10 of us at one table that I believe was meant to fit 8ppl max. The chairs were not the correct height to match the table. So not only were we tight, but we were much lower than we should have been. The food was okay, nothing special. The drinks were tiny and full of ice and sugar. I guess they had no room for alcohol because no one at my table believe any of our drinks had an ounce of alcohol. Lastly, everything (especially the drinks) was pricier than I expected. Google has them as “two dollar-signs” but they should definitely be three, maybe they’ve raised prices, idk. I’d honestly be surprised if this place survives the winter. Never again.

originalText.text: We had an awesome hibachi experience at this Chinese/Dominican fusion location. All the staff was friendly(thank you Carlos) our cook was funny, and the restaurant was nicely decorated so it was great for pictures as well. I love that they served is a bowl of sancocho before our actual meal. The wings were delicious!! The chicken dumplings gave me more of a chicken empanada feel but it goes with the theme, they were good as well. This bill was for a total of 7 of us, Id say the food is reasonably priced but they drinks were a bit pricey… especially the uptown colada. We had an amazing time overall, would definitely come back! :)

originalText.text: Unintentionally had the whole upstairs to ourselves. Loved that. But the highlight of our experience was Carlos! Loveddd how much you could tell how much he cared about customer experience. Had a nice talk with him closer to the end of our dining meal and it was really genuine. Thank you for the conversation Carlos. I also liked how the host checked on us also and gave us our other round. Definitely coming back and bringing friends. Their new happy hour is AMAZING!

originalText.text: Went here last night with a group of 9. We had a reservation and sat at the hibachi. There was no wait. The service was okay, not super welcoming, but not horrible. It wasn’t very full on a Saturday night on a busy street. Our chef was very nice and listened to our requests for how we wanted the food made. The food was good, it was a nice experience, but very pricy compared to any other hibachi I have gone to. They didn’t have many menu options either. Not sure if they have a different menu for non hibachi seating. One thing they should fix is the fire alarm, they had one near the hibachi and it kept going off.
